explanation: The report is correct. The code calls strstr(boundary, "boundary=") and strlen(boundary) on a pointer derived as boundary = &encoding[MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(...)] where encoding comes from MHD_lookup_connection_value_n as pos->value. MHD_lookup_connection_value_n returns the pointer but does not guarantee the returned buffer is NUL-terminated (it can also provide a separate value_size). If the header value is not NUL-terminated, or if its stored length is exactly the prefix length, boundary can point at or past the last valid character (one-past-end), and calling strstr/strlen will scan for a NUL and thus may access memory beyond the bounds of the underlying object. That violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (In addition, the custom MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ function indexes encoding up to maxlen and could itself read out-of-bounds if the header value is shorter than the compared prefix.) To comply, the code must ensure the header value is NUL-terminated (or operate using the known value_size and length-limited routines/copies) before calling standard string.h functions.
